sentence: Home improvement warehouse operator The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) on Wednesday backed its full-year profit and sales outlook and unveiled plans to buy back even more stock.
The Atlanta-based company said it still expects full-year 2012 earnings of $2.90 per share, which would match Wall Street's view.
HD also said it now expects to repurchase $4.0 billion of its own shares, a $500 million increase from its original expectation provided last month.
The company noted the additional buybacks should not affect its fiscal 2012 earnings results.
Shares of Home Depot ( HD ) have a 2.37% dividend yield, based on last night's closing stock price of $48.92.
The stock has technical support in the $45 price area.
If the shares can firm up, we see overhead resistance around the $50-$53 price levels.
The Home Depot, Inc. ( HD ) is not recommended at this time, holding a Dividend.com DARSâ„¢ Rating of 3.4 out of 5 stars.
